title: 113_hr5081
content: The Act may be cited as the "Strengthening Child Welfare Response to Trafficking Act of 2014". It includes amendments to CAPTA. Section 106 of the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include provisions and procedures for identifying and assessing reports involving children who are sex trafficking victims or victims of severe forms of trafficking. The Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include provisions for training State child protective services representatives on identifying and assessing children who are sex trafficking victims. This may also cover training on identifying victims of severe forms of trafficking. Additionally, there are provisions for identifying services provided by State law enforcement officials. The Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include provisions for training State child protective services representatives on identifying and assessing children who are sex trafficking victims, including victims of severe forms of trafficking. This covers procedures for appropriate referral to address the needs of these children, including identification of services provided by State law enforcement officials and social service agencies. The Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include provisions for training State child protective services representatives on identifying and assessing children who are sex trafficking victims. This includes procedures for appropriate referral to address the needs of these children, with a focus on services provided by State law enforcement officials and social service agencies. Amendments also define the term 'sex trafficking victim' as a victim of sex trafficking. The Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include provisions for training State child protective services representatives on identifying and assessing children who are sex trafficking victims. This includes procedures for appropriate referral to address the needs of these children, with a focus on services provided by State law enforcement officials and social service agencies. Amendments also define the term 'sex trafficking victim' as a victim of sex trafficking, as per the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000. The Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include provisions for training State child protective services representatives on identifying and assessing children who are sex trafficking victims, as defined in the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000. This involves procedures for appropriate referral to address the needs of these children, with a focus on services provided by State law enforcement officials and social service agencies. Additionally, the amendments aim to identify children who are victims of severe forms of trafficking in persons. The Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act is amended to include provisions for training State child protective services representatives on identifying and assessing children who are sex trafficking victims. The Secretary of Health and Human Services must submit a report to Congress within a year of this Act's enactment, detailing the prevalence of severe trafficking in children under state child welfare agencies. The report should also outline the practices used by states to identify and assist child victims of trafficking. The report to Congress must detail the prevalence of severe trafficking in children under state child welfare agencies, including identifying and assisting child victims of trafficking. It also specifies barriers in Federal laws that may prevent the identification of trafficked children. Definitions include "severe form of trafficking in persons" as defined in the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000. The term "victim of trafficking" is defined in the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000. The Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 defines the term "victim of trafficking." Passed by the House of Representatives on July 25, 2014. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
